column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0004] Denim is considered to be world's one of the oldest fabric.
#Text=The popularity of denim fabrics is high in almost every age group.
#Text=Denim fabrics provide comfort, durability, versatility and glamour.
#Text=The decolorization of denim fabrics are done by processes such as stone washing, ice washing, sand blasting, rubbing with sand paper or pumice stone etc.
#Text=Neutralization process using hot water and chemicals, and processes utilizing potassium permanganate spray are also used to provide the desired fading effect.
#Text=Pat.
#Text=No. 7,252,688 to Tashiro on Aug. 7, 2007 teaches an apparatus for decolorizing a textile product using ozone.
#Text=The apparatus enables the decolorization rate to be adjusted by adjusting the water content of the textile product and controlling the ozone concentration to achieve uniform decolorization.

#Text=The decolorization apparatus includes an airtight container, a rotary drum which rotates in the airtight container, an ozone generator connected with the airtight container through an automatic valve, a water supply unit, and a blower unit which includes an air heater and supplies hot air and cool air to the airtight container.
#Text=The ozone concentration inside the airtight container is maintained at a desired level by measuring the ozone concentration using an ozone analyzer and controlling the ozone generator.

#Text=While the particular invention fulfills their is respective objectives, the device lacks an ozone monitoring unit for monitoring the concentration of ozone in ambient for providing safety of operation.
#Text=Pat.

#Text=No. 6,024,766 to Wasinger on Feb. 15, 2000 discloses a process of desizing textiles with enzymes together with a subsequent step of deactivating any residual enzymes to prevent degradation of the textiles.
#Text=There is further provided a step or removal of any residual sizing and/or decolorizing dyed garments with ozone.
#Text=However, in this process costly enzymes are utilized for decolorizing the fabrics.
#Text=Moreover, this process also requires chemicals that have high cost and unfriendly to the environment.
#Text=Pat.
#Text=No. 5,313,811 to Wasinger on May 24, 1994 discloses an apparatus for laundering and treating garments or fabrics with an oxidizing agent.
#Text=The apparatus includes a housing having a chamber containing a barrel mounted for rotation.
#Text=A door is provided for placing the garments or fabrics into the chamber.
#Text=Associated with the housing is a venturi mixer for introducing an oxidizing gas and a liquid into the chamber and a value for removing liquid from the chamber.
#Text=Controls are provided to selectively permit a washing, extracting and abrading cycle.
#Text=However, this device utilizes hot steam for treating the garments thereby wasting a considerable amount of energy.

#Text=[0008] Therefore there is a need for an improved apparatus for decolorizing a denim fabric with an oxidizing gas that would have an ozone monitoring unit for monitoring the is concentration of ozone in ambient for providing safety of operation.
#Text=Such an apparatus would be free from costly enzymes and chemicals that would have high cost and unfriendly to the environment.
#Text=Moreover, such an apparatus would eliminate the usage of hot steam thereby saving energy.
#Text=The present invention accomplishes these objectives.
